org.cripac.isee.pedestrian.attr

Class ExternPedestrianAttrRecognizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cripac.isee.pedestrian.attr.PedestrianAttrRecognizer
      • org.cripac.isee.pedestrian.attr.ExternPedestrianAttrRecognizer

  • public class ExternPedestrianAttrRecognizer
extends PedestrianAttrRecognizer
    The class ExternPedestrianAttrRecognizer is a recognizer of pedestrian attributes that depend on external solvers connected with sockets. It sends recognition requests each containing a track to the solver, then receives responses containing the attributes. The requests and responses are processed asynchronously, matched by request UUID. Request format

    16 bytes - Request UUID. 4 bytes - Tracklet length (number of bounding boxes).

    foreach bounding box: {

    16 bytes - Bounding box data (x, y, width, height).

    width * height * 3 bytes - Image data.

    }

    Response format

    16 bytes - Request UUID.

    4 bytes - Length of JSON representing the attributes (jsonLen).

    jsonLen bytes - Bytes of UTF-8 JSON string representing the attributes.

    Author:
    Ken Yu, CRIPAC, 2016
